decks.notes: The key focus of this UW Control deck is to manipulate the board through counterspells, removal, and card draw in order to control the pace of the game. By disrupting the opponent's plan with cards like Settle the Wreckage, Cryptic Command, and Path to Exile, while also generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponent. The inclusion of Geist of Saint Traft and Monastery Mentor provides a win condition by pressuring the opponent with aggressive threats while still maintaining control over the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana to play powerful threats and control the game. It utilizes various tutors and card draw spells to find the necessary pieces quickly. The deck also incorporates removal spells like Dismember and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The win conditions include big threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Emrakul, the Promised End, and Karn Liberated, as well as board wipes and versatile options like Walking Ballista and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon.

The main idea of this deck is to efficiently control the game using the UrzaTron lands, Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine, in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful spells and threats, such as Mindslaver, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while also disrupting their opponent with counterspells and removal spells like Condescend and Dismember. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by using card advantage and powerful threats to take control of the game.

The deck focuses on gaining life through Martyr of Sands and using that life gain to power up Serra Ascendant. It also utilizes cards like Proclamation of Rebirth and Emeria, the Sky Ruin to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes a strong control aspect with cards like Ghostly Prison and removal spells like Path to Exile and Wrath of God. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents by controlling the board while building up a powerful life total for its key creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Street Wraith, Bloodghast, and Flamewake Phoenix to cast low-cost threats like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry, the deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive playstyle, overwhelming the opponent before they can establish a defense. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality to help deal with any threats that may disrupt its game plan.

The primary focus of this Modern Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board with a range of discard spells such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also utilizing efficient removal options like Fatal Push and Collective Brutality. The deck aims to steadily chip away at the opponent's life total by utilizing cards like Shrieking Affliction and The Rack, while maintaining control of the board through cards like Smallpox and Liliana of the Veil. The deck also utilizes land synergy with Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Mutavault to maximize its potential.

This Abzan Aggro deck aims to disrupt opponents' hands with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also removing threats with Path to Exile, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, Scavenging Ooze, and Grim Flayer to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. Lingering Souls provides additional value with flying tokens, while planeswalkers Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope help control the board and generate card advantage. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and can also provide lifegain with Shambling Vent.

The deck focuses on assembling combos with creatures that can generate value and synergy, allowing the player to search for specific creatures and create powerful board states. By utilizing cards like Collected Company, Chord of Calling, and Vizier of Remedies, the deck can quickly find and play key pieces like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana and win the game with Walking Ballista or other combo finishers. The toolbox nature of the deck allows for adaptability and flexibility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, drawing cards, and removing threats while utilizing Madcap Experiment to cheat out Platinum Emperion, creating a difficult to deal with board state. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana base. The deck aims to stabilize the board and establish control until it can close out the game with powerful creatures or burn spells, ultimately out-valuing the opponent.

The main focus of this Modern 1 vs 1 Eldrazi Aggro deck is to ramp up quickly using the Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Endbringer. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to control the game, while also featuring removal options like Dismember. With access to powerful threats and disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive and resilient game plan.

This deck relies on quickly emptying its hand to lower its own life total and power up Death's Shadow, a key threat. Utilizing low-cost spells and efficient removal, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while hitting hard and fast with a large, disruptive creature. The deck also includes ways to protect its threats and generate additional value through graveyard interaction and card advantage. It is designed to put pressure on the opponent from the very beginning and maintain that pressure until victory is secured.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting a large number of spells in a single turn to storm off and win the game with cards like Grapeshot. Cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer reduce the mana cost of spells, allowing for explosive turns. Gifts Ungiven is used to find key combo pieces, while card selection spells like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help dig for the necessary cards. The deck aims to chain spells together efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win in a single explosive turn.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, allowing you to bring back creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. By constantly dredging and bringing back creatures, you can overwhelm your opponent with an army of creatures and generate value from cards like Conflagrate. The deck focuses on graveyard synergy and utilizing the graveyard as a resource to create a powerful board presence and ultimately win the game through aggressive creature attacks.

The core focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands - Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine - to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful colorless threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn Liberated to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to search for the Tron lands consistently, along with other utility cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to deal with threats and disrupt graveyard strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures in order to consistently bring back Vengevine and Hollow One from the graveyard to the battlefield. Using cards like Faithless Looting and Goblin Lore to discard cards and draw into more creatures, along with the aggressive nature of the deck with cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Flameblade Adept, allows for fast and powerful plays to overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to apply constant pressure and win the game through aggressive attacks and powerful graveyard synergies.

This deck utilizes aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf, coupled with disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, to quickly diminish the opponent's resources and life total. It also includes ways to manipulate the size of Death's Shadow through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Street Wraith, allowing for explosive plays and strategies. The deck aims to control the board early on and then finish the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.
